content.text:
# Battle of Krupczyce

| date              = 17 September 1794 (6th O.S.)
| place             = Krupczyce, Brest Litovsk Voivodeship, Grand Duchy of Lithuania
| result            = Russian victory
| combatant1        =  Russia
| combatant2        =  Poland–Lithuania
| commander1        =  Alexander Suvorov Fyodor Buksgevden Ivan Isaev
| commander2        =   Stanisław Kosmowski
| strength1         = 12,000 men,39 cannons
| strength2         = 4,000 men,26 cannons
| casualties1       = 325–700
| casualties2       = ~3,000 killed, wounded, or captured ('''Suvorov's report)
* 300 killed (Polish source)
}}
The Battle of Krupczyce''' took place between the Russian Empire's armed forces under the command of Alexander Vasilyevich Suvorov and Kościuszko's Polish-Lithuanian rebels under Karol Józef Sierakowski east of Brest (near the Krupczyce Abbey), present-day Belarus, on September 17, 1794. It was part of the Kościuszko Uprising and ended with the defeat of the rebels.
